author: ec2
content: Hey yall, has some thoughts yesterday. Right now, it looks like we order fields in our data structures by logical grouping. Assuming we start to cache intermediate hashes in SSZ, would it not make sense to order fields based on how often they are updated?

author: ec2
content: This will make it so that when we do update fields, we would be doing less hashes.

author: ec2
content: So instead of logical grouping, we can order fields by: never changes, changes every epoch, changes every slot, for ex

author: protolambda
content: <@!155823130668040192> We already do that by separating balances from validator registry. The other state fields are not as interesting, as they are either really small, or all trees of simple values that change one at a time. Much less to gain there by moving things around in the state definition.
